intro: Dianthus bulgaricus, commonly known as the Bulgarian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to meadows and gardens. Dianthus bulgaricus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
